original_text: Through our partnership with Renewable Future Fund, we installed 80,000 solar panels across our warehouses, generating 25% of our annual electricity and reducing CO₂ emissions by 45,000 tons in one year.
We provided full transparency in our supply chain audit this year, with third-party verification of fair labor practices across 93% of our suppliers. The results are published on our website.
In 2022, we diverted over 300,000 pounds of textile waste from landfills through our national clothing recycling initiative, partnering with community centers in 50 states.

We launched a $10 million fund to support smallholder farmers transitioning to organic farming, impacting over 12,000 livelihoods across South America. Progress is tracked in quarterly impact reports.
We have committed to fully recyclable packaging by 2025, with 68% of all current product lines already meeting that standard as of this report, verified by the Sustainable Packaging Coalition.
Our logistics division optimized routes and transitioned 30% of delivery vehicles to electric, reducing fuel consumption by 2.4 million liters and emissions by 6,000 tons.
In collaboration with the Ocean Cleanup Project, we removed 2,500 tons of plastic waste from coastal areas and supported educational programs in 300 schools.
In 2023, 78% of our workforce participated in company-sponsored volunteer programs, contributing 150,000 hours to community development projects across 18 countries.
We are proud to lead the industry in sustainable practices and have made improvements to reduce our impact, including new energy-saving technologies in our offices.
Our team continues to implement green thinking in everything we do. We’ve taken steps toward eliminating single-use plastics but are still evaluating our progress.
Our sustainability strategy involves reducing our carbon footprint, improving energy efficiency, and sourcing responsibly — all while maintaining our world-class products.
We recognize the urgency of climate change and are proud to announce our sustainability council. Specific action plans are still under development.
This year, we made great progress in our mission to become more eco-conscious, including reducing energy use at select facilities and planning future initiatives.
We're taking steps to integrate more sustainable business models, though many of our projects are still in pilot phases and data is limited.
We are deeply committed to protecting the planet and consider sustainability a core value of our brand.
Our dedication to the environment is reflected in everything we do, and we continuously strive to be eco-friendly leaders.
At GreenCo, we believe in building a better future, and sustainability is one of the many things we care about.
We always put the planet first and make responsible choices every day in all our operations.
Our brand supports environmental initiatives globally, and we stand for making the world a better place.
We remain committed to exploring sustainable opportunities and playing our role in fighting climate change.
Sustainability is in our DNA. We aim to make responsible choices and build an eco-conscious culture.
We love the environment and constantly think about how we can make a difference, staying true to our mission of sustainability.
We're proud of our sustainability journey and continue looking for ways to innovate, including eco-friendly pilot programs across select departments.
We implemented  waste-reduction protocol across our supply chain, resulting in a 25% decrease in non-recyclable waste materials
We love the environment and constantly think about how we can make a difference, staying true to our mission of sustainability.
We implemented a verified waste-reduction protocol across our various departments

We are working towards integrating more sustainable fabrics in our clothing lines. While only 10% of our current offerings meet this standard, our design team is passionate about creating a greener future.
Our new headquarters was built with sustainability in mind, featuring smart lighting and energy-saving features. We believe this symbolizes our dedication to innovation and the plane
We’re all about harmony with nature. Our brand reflects a love for the Earth and a promise to keep doing what’s right for the planet.
We’ve taken early steps toward becoming plastic-free by trialing biodegradable utensils in a few retail locations. This is just the beginning of our sustainability evolution
We’re proud to be a company that cares. Environmental responsibility is in our ethos, and we continue exploring ways to align with the planet’s needs
Our net-zero energy store in Vista, California, retrofitted in 2022, successfully produced more than 100% of its energy needs by 2023.
We eliminated approximately 6.0 million cubic feet of EPS and more than 39 million square feet of PVC film from our private-brand packaging in 2023.
We have reported a 49% reduction in absolute Scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions since 2016, demonstrating significant progress towards our net-zero emissions goal.
We set a goal to reach net-zero emissions across Scope 1, 2, and 3 GHG emissions by 2050, in accordance with guidelines from the Science Based Targets initiative.
We nnounced a commitment to produce and procure energy from 335 megawatts of renewable and alternative energy projects by 2025.
We understand that for a business to last, it must have a fundamental reason for being – which is found in the value it creates not only for shareholders, but for the world
We are leveraging size and scale to benefit people, the planet, and drive business, without detailing specific measurable outcomes. ​
We know that running a sustainable operation is not only good for the environment – it's good for business
We take pride in making homes better for all, and part of doing that is reducing our impact on the environment

We believe that sustainability is a journey, and we are committed to making positive changes.
